Issues.Title: Move IHandle to Interop.
Issues.Body:
This allows using the interface in other assemblies outside of System.Windows.Forms. We can't, however, use classes that implement from different assemblies. If we wanted to use Control in interop calls in assemblies other than System.Windows.Forms we'd have to make this an actual shared interface. The only practical way to do that is to introduce a higher level shared assembly that contains it. While SWF is effectively top-level, making internals visible would be less than ideal.

Ultimately we may want to create an Interop assembly that all of our other assemblies can rely on. It would make this really reusable, reduce code duplication, and generally make maintenance a bit easier.

related to https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2221#issuecomment-551417744

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/2348)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Move IHandle to Interop." (#2348)

Issues.Title: Porting a VS fix to designer host site nested container
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #2325

## Proposed changes
Initialize IServiceContainer in the nested container as soon as INestedContainer is created, otherwise site has no access to the DesignerHost's services. Initialize IServiceContainer in the nested container as soon as INestedContainer is created, otherwise site has no access to the DesignerHost's services.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk
low

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
unit test

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Porting a VS fix to designer host site nested container" (#2326)

Issues.Title: [port from VS] harden DesignerHostSite against GetService failure for DesignerHost-level services
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0+
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: **Yes**/No - this had been recently fixed in the Visual Studio sources

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
Once INestedContainer is instantiated, GetService attempts to look up services in the IServiceContainer, which internally points to the DesignerHost. We have to ensure that service container is initialized as soon as INestedContainer is instantiated to avoid unexpected failures to get DesignerHost-level services.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[port from VS] harden DesignerHostSite against GetService failure for DesignerHost-level services" (#2325)
